content.question:
Mutations in DNA are usually caused by chemical or radiation damage to DNA molecules, followed by imperfect repair of the damage. Immediately after this kind of imperfect repair, there may be a mismatched base pair in the DNA. The illustration below shows an example of a mismatch, with the relevant pair bases in bold.

Which of the following best represents the DNA of the two daughter cells produced when a bacterial cell with this particular mismatch replicates its DNA and divides?

choices.label: The figure shows two D N A strands. The top D N A strand is labeled Normal, and has the base pair G C in bold. The bottom D N A strand is labeled Normal, and has the corresponding base pair G C in bold.

The figure shows two D N A strands. The top D N A strand is labeled Mutant, and has the base pair A T in bold. The bottom D N A stand is labeled Normal, and has the corresponding base pair G C in bold.

The figure shows two D N A strands. The top D N A strand is labeled Mutant, and has the base pair A T in bold. The bottom D N A stand is labeled Mutant, and has the corresponding base pair A T in bold.

The figure shows two D N A strands. The top D N A strand is labeled Mutant, and has the base pair A C in bold. The bottom D N A stand is labeled Mutant, and has the corresponding base pair A C in bold.

content.answer: The figure shows two D N A strands. The top D N A strand is labeled Mutant, and has the base pair A T in bold. The bottom D N A stand is labeled Normal, and has the corresponding base pair G C in bold.
